snippet: In an unlikely meeting of the minds, scholars from the left and the right managed to craft a compelling set of recommendations, despite their differences.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines report published by 15-member group of conservative and progressive scholars that details comprehensive view of how to improve anti-poverty strategy that has fallen far short of its goals; says report is indication that poverty may have gotten so bad that it might inspire bipartisan solution; suggests report shows that lot of common ground exists between conservatives and liberals on issue.
lead_paragraph: In an unlikely meeting of the minds, scholars from the left and the right managed to craft a compelling set of recommendations, despite their differences.
